author: Michael Kerner
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2017
review_content: Honestly, what I have loved about the days of Sega when they a video game company, was that they absolutely made great games in the process. Sonic The Hedgehog was absolutely the lynch pin that made Sega a dynamo for gamers young and old. But since the 90's, Sega has really failed to deliver the strike in what has made the best video games that drove gamers from start-to-finish. They have been struggling to make better gaming apps, and instead have constantly went back on reviving the success  Sonic Rush, Sega's debut with making apps for tablets and smartphones, was nothing more than a simple run & jump game that was nothing new compared to games like Temple Run & Subway Surfers. Sonic Forces: Speed Battle doesn't do enough to challenge you as a gamer to make you feel more of the thrill of the need for blue speed. The game is a fair game, but in regards to what Sonic The Hedgehog had been during his glory days, it really isn't as thrilling as Sonic Mani had shown for Sega as a downloadable game for the Sony PS4, Nintendo Switch and Xbox One. Overall, i would recommend that you pass this one up, unless you are a hard core Sonic fan who want a change of pace in action games. This is not as fun as Super Mario Run showed this past year.
